MEDG_V 421-001 - Genetics and Cell Biology of Cancer
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
MEDG 421 is fully-registered. Workday will give you an option to add yourself to the waitlist and the system will automatically register a waitlisted student if a seat becomes available.

OPTIONAL textbook: "The Biology of Cancer" by Robert A. Weinberg (2nd Edition)
Note: A background in cell biology is assumed - a grade of B or higher in BIOL 335 is strongly recommended. The course requires extensive independent reading of scientific journal articles. If you'd like to be added to the MEDG 421 waitlist, please contact the course coordinators, Dr. Evgin at Laura.evgin@ubc.ca and Dr. Stirling at pstirling@bccrc.ca.

Course Section: MICB_V 404-201 - Topics in Molecular Bacterial Pathogenesis
Course Section Definition Public Notes: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations.  Students should register into the wait-list at the present time.  Student that are on the wait-lists for MICB 404, 406, 412 and 413 will be asked to rank their preferences for registration - please send an email to Dr. Kion after you have registered.  Depending on the demand for these courses, students may be registered in only one course (this will happen in mid-July).  If seats remain open, students may be registered into a second course.  Students should consult Workday Student on a regular basis in late July to see if they have been moved into the course. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

Students will need to have a faculty mentor from the Department of Microbiology & Immunology before registration into MICB 448B.  See the following URL for faculty that may have seats open in their laboratories.  https://www.microbiology.ubc.ca/faculty-staff/faculty. After you have a faculty mentor agree to have you work in their lab, contact Dr. Kion at tkion@mail.ubc.ca for registration into the course.  Include your student number and the name of your faculty mentor.

Applications in Synthetic Biology -  Self-directed, collaborative studies in a group-learning environment. Self-initiated and coordinated by upper-level undergraduate students with the supervision of a faculty advisor. Not suitable as an MICB course selection to meet MBIM, MBIM/CSPC or MICB/OCEA specialization requirements.

Course Section: MINE_V 406-201 - Mine Project Valuation and Risk Assessment

Course Section Definition Public Notes: Students must register for both Lecture and Lab in order to complete registration for the course. The lab section is a placeholder; you will only need to attend the course.

Please note that you will be required to register for this lab accompanying the course, despite the fact there is no lab offered at this time. Please register for the course and lab; you will just need to attend the course.
